SEARCH

Class SynthesizerEngine

java.lang.Object
SynthesizerEngine
public class SynthesizerEngine extends Object
A formant-based speech synthesizer engine. This engine converts text into audio by: 1. Transcribing the text into a sequence of phonemes using PhoneticTranscriber. 2. Looking up the acoustic properties for each phoneme (formants, noise profiles, etc.). 3. Synthesizing an audio waveform for each phoneme from scratch. 4. Applying a basic intonation (prosody) model to the sequence. 5. Stitching the individual phoneme audio clips together with cross-fading. 6. Playing the final audio through the system's sound hardware.

    SynthesizerEngine.Phoneme
    A data class holding the acoustic parameters for a single phoneme.

  • Method Details

    • speak

      public void speak(String text)
      The main entry point to synthesize speech from a string of text.
      Parameters:
      text - The text to speak.

    • stitchAudio

      private static float[] stitchAudio(List<float[]> seq, int ms)
      Stitches a sequence of audio clips together, using a short cross-fade to smooth the transitions.
      Parameters:
      seq - A list of float arrays, each representing an audio clip.
      ms - The duration of the cross-fade in milliseconds.
      Returns:
      A single float array containing the combined audio.

    • playAudio

      private void playAudio(byte[] audioData)
      Plays a byte array of audio data through the system's default audio output.
      Parameters:
      audioData - The raw 16-bit PCM audio data.

    • generateVoicedSource

      private static float[] generateVoicedSource(int numSamples, int fundamental, double[] envelope)
      Generates the "source" signal for a voiced sound - a sawtooth wave. This represents the buzzing of the vocal cords before it's shaped by the mouth.
      Parameters:
      numSamples - The length of the audio to generate.
      fundamental - The pitch (F0).
      envelope - An amplitude envelope to apply to the source.
      Returns:
      The generated source signal.

    • synthVowel

      private static float[] synthVowel(int nS, int fund, double[] sF, double[] eF)
      Synthesizes a vowel by filtering a voiced source through formant filters.
      Parameters:
      nS - Number of samples.
      fund - Fundamental frequency.
      sF - Start formant frequencies.
      eF - End formant frequencies (for diphthongs).
      Returns:
      The vowel audio clip.

    • synthFricative

      private static float[] synthFricative(int nS, int fund, double amp, double f1, double f2, double q, boolean voiced)
      Synthesizes a fricative sound by filtering white noise. Multiple layers of slightly different filtered noise are used for a richer sound.

    • synthPlosive

      private static float[] synthPlosive(int nS, int fund, double amp, double burstFreq, double burstQ, boolean voiced, SynthesizerEngine.Phoneme nextPhoneme)
      Synthesizes a plosive sound, which consists of silence, a noise burst, and aspiration.

    • normalize

      private static void normalize(float[] audio, double targetPeak)
      Normalizes an audio clip to a target peak amplitude.
      Parameters:
      audio - The audio data to normalize.
      targetPeak - The desired peak level (e.g., 1.0).

    • createEnvelope

      private static double[] createEnvelope(int numSamples, double attackMs, double releaseMs)
      Creates a simple Attack-Sustain-Release (ASR) amplitude envelope.
      Parameters:
      numSamples - Total length of the envelope.
      attackMs - Duration of the attack phase.
      releaseMs - Duration of the release phase.
      Returns:
      An array of amplitude values from 0.0 to 1.0.

    • floatTo16BitByteArray

      private static byte[] floatTo16BitByteArray(float[] audio)
      Converts a float audio array [-1.0, 1.0] to a 16-bit big-endian byte array.
